definition: Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Zhejiang, part of the kingdom of Wu, passed into the Chinese orbit in the 3d cent. B. C.
sentences.chinese: 浙江作为吴国的一部分于蜀汉时代进入中国的版图。

sentences.english: After ten years of careful preparations, he attacked and finally conquered the State of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 经过十年艰苦奋斗，越过终于雪耻战胜吴国。

sentences.english: It was from here that he successfully fled to the State of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 他就是从这儿顺利地逃到吴国的。

sentences.english: So he put aside his dignity, they are willing to Wu to become a pawn.
sentences.chinese: 于是他放下尊严，甘愿到吴国去当马前卒。

sentences.english: Therefore, Wu and Shu united to defend his attack.
sentences.chinese: 因此吴国和蜀国联合起来抗曹。

sentences.english: The State of Wu always covetously eyed the State of Zhao.
sentences.chinese: 吴国一直雄视着赵国，虎视眈眈。

sentences.english: Wu won the battle after 3 hours because of the setting. No pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 吴国死守三小时后获胜，没有追击。

sentences.english: Zhao Wei will play Sun Shangxiang, the little sister of Sun Quan, the emperor of the Wu Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 赵薇将在影片中扮演吴国皇帝孙权的小妹孙上香。

sentences.english: Wu Kuo-chen was the Kuomintang mayor of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 吴国桢，当时任国民党政府上海市长。

sentences.english: Was Sun Quan the emperor of the State of Wu during the Three Kingdom Period?
sentences.chinese: 那么孙权就是三国鼎立时的吴国皇帝是吗？

sentences.english: The Kingdom of Yue surrendered as it was losing the war with the Kingdom of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 越国在和吴国的战争中失败了，向吴国投降。

sentences.english: The Kingdom of Yue surrendered as it was losing the war with the Kingdom of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 越国在和吴国的战争中失败了，向吴国投降。

sentences.english: Completed all of the Wu Alliance Battles in Conquest Mode.
sentences.chinese: 在无双模式中完成所有吴国的联盟战役。

sentences.english: This stone tablet was from Wu, which was established by Yang Hsin Mi in the period of Five-Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 本碑铭，是我国五代时期，杨行密所创建的吴国之物。

sentences.english: He later heard that Prince built in the Song, they found him defect to Wu.
sentences.chinese: 后来他听说太子建在宋国，便找到他一起投奔吴国。

definition: Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Sichuan/the state of Shu in Sichuan at different periods/the Shu Han dynasty (214-263) of Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 during the Three Kingdoms
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸/also called 吳王闔廬|吴王阖庐
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC)/also called 闔廬|阖庐
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Wu Zixu (-484 BC), powerful politician in Wu/famous as destitute refugee begging in Wu town, cf 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫
